body_html:
There is an effort to make Model.save work with TensorFlow formats (SavedModel). Right now it requires get_config() and from_config() to be implemented for subclassed Models, but that could change (@k-w-w has been iterating on tf.contrib.saved_model.save_keras_model).

On the doc issue, maybe we should reference save_weights/load_weights from save for now? Those work fine with subclassed Models (+eager). It won't save the Model, but neither does tf.train.Checkpoint. Happy to review a PR for that @lc0 , or I can get to it (but not super soon).
body_text:
There is an effort to make Model.save work with TensorFlow formats (SavedModel). Right now it requires get_config() and from_config() to be implemented for subclassed Models, but that could change (@k-w-w has been iterating on tf.contrib.saved_model.save_keras_model).
On the doc issue, maybe we should reference save_weights/load_weights from save for now? Those work fine with subclassed Models (+eager). It won't save the Model, but neither does tf.train.Checkpoint. Happy to review a PR for that @lc0 , or I can get to it (but not super soon).
body:
There is an effort to make `Model.save` work with TensorFlow formats (SavedModel). Right now it requires `get_config()` and `from_config()` to be implemented for subclassed Models, but that could change (@k-w-w has been iterating on `tf.contrib.saved_model.save_keras_model`). 

On the doc issue, maybe we should reference `save_weights`/`load_weights` from `save` for now? Those work fine with subclassed `Model`s (+eager). It won't save the `Model`, but neither does `tf.train.Checkpoint`. Happy to review a PR for that @lc0 , or I can get to it (but not super soon).
